user.title: Connect to Yarbo
user.description: Enter the IP address of your Yarbo base station (Data Center). The integration will connect to the local MQTT broker on port 1883.

manual.title: Enter connection details
manual.description: No Yarbo devices were found on the network. Enter the base station IP address and MQTT port manually.

confirm.title: Yarbo Discovered
confirm.description: A Yarbo base station was discovered at **{host}**. Proceed to connect?

select_endpoint.title: Choose MQTT Endpoint
select_endpoint.description: We found **{count}** path(s) to your Yarbo mower. Both connect to the same broker — the Data Center path is recommended for reliability.

mqtt_test.title: Connecting to Yarbo
mqtt_test.description: Testing MQTT connection and waiting for telemetry from your robot...

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Yarbo
reconfigure.description: Update the IP address of your Yarbo base station.

name.title: Name Your Robot
name.description: Choose a name for your Yarbo robot. This will be used for all entity names.

cloud.title: Cloud Features (Optional)
cloud.description: Optionally connect to the Yarbo cloud for firmware updates and device info. Not required for local control. Leave blank to skip.

reauth_confirm.title: Re-authenticate Yarbo Cloud
reauth_confirm.description: Your Yarbo cloud session for **{username}** has expired. Enter your password to reconnect.

abort.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to MQTT broker at {host}:1883. Is the base station powered on and reachable?
abort.no_telemetry: Connected but no robot telemetry received within 10 seconds. Is the robot powered on?
abort.decode_error: Received data but cannot decode it. Firmware may be incompatible.
abort.wrong_device: The discovered device does not match this Yarbo robot.

error.cloud_auth_failed: Cloud authentication failed — check your email and password
error.cloud_not_available: Cloud client not available — update python-yarbo

init.title: Yarbo Options
init.description: Configure integration behaviour. Changes take effect immediately (no restart required).

data_description.telemetry_throttle: How often telemetry updates are pushed to Home Assistant. Lower values mean more frequent updates but higher recorder load.
data_description.activity_personality: When enabled, the activity sensor includes fun emoji descriptions as extra attributes.

telemetry_timeout.title: Yarbo telemetry not received
telemetry_timeout.description: No telemetry has been received from **{name}** for at least 60 seconds. Check that the base station is powered on and connected to the network.

mqtt_disconnect.title: Yarbo base station unreachable
mqtt_disconnect.description:
No telemetry has been received from **{name}** for at least 60 seconds. The robot may be out of range or the base station may be powered off.

**Steps to resolve:**
1. Check that the Yarbo Data Center (base station) is powered on.
2. Verify that the base station is connected to your local network.
3. Confirm that Home Assistant can reach the base station IP address.

This issue will resolve automatically when telemetry resumes.

confirm.title: Re-acquire controller
confirm.description:
The Yarbo app or another client has taken the controller session for **{name}**, preventing Home Assistant from sending commands.

Press **Submit** to re-acquire the controller session.

abort.cannot_connect: Could not re-acquire the controller session. Check that the Yarbo base station is reachable and try again.
abort.unknown: An unexpected error occurred while re-acquiring the controller session.

cloud_token_expired.title: Yarbo cloud session expired
cloud_token_expired.description: The Yarbo cloud session for **{name}** has expired (401/403). Re-authenticate to restore cloud features (e.g. firmware version check).

confirm.title: Re-authenticate cloud
confirm.description: Your Yarbo cloud token for **{name}** has expired. Press **Submit** to open the re-authentication flow and enter your password again.

send_command.name: Send raw command
send_command.description: Publish an arbitrary MQTT command to the robot (power users only).

start_plan.name: Start work plan
start_plan.description: Start a saved work plan by its ID.

pause.name: Pause
pause.description: Pause the robot's current work plan.

resume.name: Resume
resume.description: Resume a previously paused work plan.

return_to_dock.name: Return to dock
return_to_dock.description: Send the robot back to its charging dock.

set_lights.name: Set lights
set_lights.description: Set brightness for all 7 LED channels simultaneously.

set_chute_velocity.name: Set chute velocity
set_chute_velocity.description: Control snow chute direction and speed (snow blower head only).
